page.title: 09CHARITY EVENTS
page.content: There are two main events during the Ashford Year, both have charitable intent. The longer running event is "Children's Day" occurring in a week near to Christmas. This is not a 'Day' but a 'Week'. The 'Day' sees a celebrity, often nationally known, turning on the Christmas decoration lights in the town. Local groups make 'floats'. The whole procession visits the town areas on different nights. Choirs, Bands, and Majorette groups follow and street markets operate _for fund_raising for Senior Citizen Groups and individuals. Carnival Day is held in the Summer, winding its way through the town ending somewhere for judging. Money raised is spread across many deserving charities, from the William Harvey Hospital to youth groups.
